result.execSummary:
The defendant Amy M Polentini-Jabs was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Credit Card-Fraudulent Use (<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.41(5)(a).
  • Credit Card-Fraudulent Use (<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.41(5)(a).
  • Credit Card-Fraudulent Use (<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.41(5)(a).
  • Credit Card-Fraudulent Use (<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.41(5)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Absolute sobriety. Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.
Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment and/or schooling.

Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. No contact with victim business except for restitution purposes. Do not drive unless properly licensed. Must comply with treatment court rules. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

Pay all court costs and supervision fees. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided. Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due. Collections may include income assignment.

2:33 PM Prosecuting attorney Raymond Robert Rutz III in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Amy M Polentini-Jabs in court, in custody.  Attorney Natalie Probst for Attorney Erin J. Preston in court for Amy M Polentini-Jabs. Court Reporter: Saige Smith. 

Parties are prepared to proceed with plea/sentencing today. 

State puts offer on the record. Defense confirms offer. 

Plea questionnaire filed. Court holds plea colloquy with defendant. 

Plea to amended charges - GUILTY : CTS 1thru 4
State consents to jury waiver. 
Agreement to use complaint for factual basis. 
BTC: GUILTY. CTS 5 thru 9 are dismissed and read in. 
Parties give arguments as to sentencing. 

BTC:
Cts 1-4, 4 months RCJ imposed and stayed to run consecutive if revoked. 
24 months probation. 

Conditions of probation:
180 days STAYED. 
Absolute sobriety. No alcohol or controlled substances unless prescribed by a physician, to be
monitored by random UA's & breathalyzers & community contacts. Any prescription must be taken as prescribed. 
Any assessments/counseling/treatment deemed appropriate by agent.
Obtain/maintain full-time employment and or schooling.
No contact with victim. 
Restitution ordered in the amount of $861.96
Must comply with treatment court rules. 
Do not drive unless properly licensed. 
Deft is Ordered to provide a DNA specimen;
Court Costs+ DNA Surcharge
Defendant accepted into Drug Court.
NG plea entered.
